intro: Adenocalymma apurense, commonly known as the Apurean adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
